result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M Grout was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>1000-2500g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $250 in drug testing fees

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
---to maintain employment employment and/or educational programming as directed by the Agent 
--to submit to random urinalyses, to occur at least once per month during the six month period after release from prison
--no possession of any possession of drug paraphernalia; no possession of any needles unless medically necessary and approved by the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for Sonya Beckstrom, and except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

It is ordered that the DOC will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.

It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order

Transcript of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on December 30, 2014 before the Honorable Judge Koschnick

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

case called at 9:11am. [MK]
Defendant Bradley M Grout in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Grout waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
Service of the Amended Complaint is admitted.  
Service of the Information is admitted; reading is waived. 
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Grout, verfiying that Mr. Grout understands it and joins in the agreement.   
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated including as to the drug repeater status; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Grout guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3.


On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Grout to  6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that Mr. Grout is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Grout is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
  

The Court gives 35 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
---to maintain employment employment and/or educational programming as directed by the Agent 
--to submit to random urinalyses, to occur at least once per month during the six month period after release from prison
--no possession of any possession of drug paraphernalia; no possession of any needles unless medically necessary and approved by the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for Sonya Beckstrom, and except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $250 in drug testing fees


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 9:39am.

Case called at 1:53 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Bradley M Grout in court, in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Grout is eligible for SPD Services
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; maximum penalties recited; reading waived
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #1 - #3
Court reviews conflict review worksheet; finds no conflict & endorses worksheet
Bond arguments by Counsel

Court requires a $5000 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No discussion of the facts of the case with co-defendant, Sonya Beckstrom or his children
-Follow all family court orders
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia including needles unless needed for medical purpose and only with prescription

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties
Recess: 2:07 pm
